comment:
Cask & Barrel 6/30/16. 
Good value $25 for cocktails
Dark, caramel, vanilla, slightly peppery

Aroma: black pepper pastrami sandwich. Taste: paint thinner. Finish: 3 sets of low simmer into a medicinal burn. Overall: the label design is the best thing about this one. 
.
.
.
.
#bourbon #whisky #whiskey #medleybros #medleybrosbourbon #drink #review #406tastingroom
Good for mixed drinks, old fashion
Had same oxidized taste as rebel yell.

와인앤모어 저가
캔터키 스트래이트 버번 위스키

향 : 가벼운 버번향, 거의 없는 알콜부즈
맛 : 강한 오일리, 약간의 버번, 
피니쉬 : 도수 높은 목넘김, 약간의 버번
smells very vanilla but sweet flavor is very subtle

Ethanol in the nose is a bit off-putting. Corn crushes it on the palate, along with some raw cereal meal and mild spice. 
Finishes with character that reminds me of yeast. Almost similar to a beer wort.

Light caramel and wood aroma with some alcohol power to it. Super spicy flavor, hits right from the start. Tons of cinnamon cut with sweetness. Medium body that I wish was heavier, but the flavor is great for the pricepoint.
Canned corn, chocolate on the end, slightly spicy, nice sweetness from the heavy corn presence
A bit rough when drank neat, added a large cube and it helped.  Probably best suited for a cocktail.

Nose: spice with slight corn sweetness

Palate: rich spice

Finish: long smooth full bodied 

Surprised by how much spice without heat for being 51 ABV
Enjoyable. Caramel and butterscotch nose. Mild swell in mouth. Flavor lingers, although I wouldn't quite call it full. Enjoyed more the more I sipped.
A straightforward and affordable cocktail bourbon. This one is a drinker, not a thinker.
"I bet this is great in cocktails" the whiskey equivalent of "I'm sure they've got a great personality".
